intro: Oldenlandia peltospermum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or creeping groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Oldenlandia peltospermum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in moist, shaded environments.
